meta.Title: CHOICE OF WORDS [New York Times, Sunday, March 16, 1952]
meta.Author: Jack Luzzatto

across.question: Grammatical device in describing past events.
Galley with two banks of oars.
It had a goat's body, lion's head and dragon's tail.
Channel at entrance to N. Y. harbor.

down.question: Man who saw the Christmas light.
Form used by J. M. Barrie.
Island shared by Portugal and Holland.
The Shakespeare of Portugal (with "de"): Port. sp.
Three-word plea for America, by J. G. Holland.
